Articles.Content:
Why hello there, fellow KSP player! I recently bought KSP and it's so buggy. I tried getting help on steam, but it didn't help. So...

The bugs are:

Missing textures on mun

Missing textures in VAB and the hangar. The walls are invisible :/ The floor tends to become transparent some times too...

I crash all the time, even though my computer should be able to run it.

When in loading screen, it freezes..

Soooo... Anyone who knows why this is happening? I was told, that it was an installation error, so i reinstalled it. That worked for 5min. and then the bugs returned.

 

thx

Can you give us your computer specs?

CPU/GPU/Operating system/ etc...

A dxdiag would be even better. Hit "windows key" + R, then type dxdiag in the field, when the info box pops up click the button that says "save all info", take that text file, open it, then copy paste the text here.

11 minutes ago, Rocket In My Pocket said:

take that text file, open it, then copy paste the text here.

Agreed, but please put it behind a spoiler, as it can be quite long.

------------------
System Information
------------------
      Time of this report: 4/2/2016, 16:20:52
             Machine name: PC-PC
         Operating System: Windows 10 Pro 32-bit (10.0, Build 10586) (10586.th2_release_sec.160223-1728)
                 Language: Moon (Regional Setting: Mooncrater x7y46z3)
      System Manufacturer: Gigabyte Technology Co., Ltd.
             System Model: GA-MA78GM-S2H
                     BIOS: Award Modular BIOS v6.00PG
                Processor: AMD Phenom(tm) II X4 920 Processor (4 CPUs), ~2.8GHz
                   Memory: 4096MB RAM
      Available OS Memory: 3326MB RAM
                Page File: 4455MB used, 3369MB available
              Windows Dir: C:\WINDOWS
          DirectX Version: 12
      DX Setup Parameters: Not found
         User DPI Setting: 96 DPI (100 percent)
       System DPI Setting: 144 DPI (150 percent)
          DWM DPI Scaling: Disabled
                 Miracast: Available, with HDCP
Microsoft Graphics Hybrid: Not Supported
           DxDiag Version: 10.00.10586.0000 32bit Unicode

___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

 

Here u go
As you may see, my computer is literally a potatobattery with some parts shoved into it... But it should still be able to run ksp :/

Hmm...I don't see a graphics card, not even an integrated one?

If that's the case you may have slightly better luck running KSP in opengl mode.

Since you are on Steam, right-click Kerbal Space Program in your Library, click "Set launch options" and put in "-force-opengl" without the quotes.

On 2.4.2016 at 4:23 PM, ezze0002 said:


                Processor: AMD Phenom(tm) II X4 920 Processor (4 CPUs), ~2.8GHz

 

From the self help thread:

 

AMD Phenom processor

Phenom CPU's can still crash even with all fixes in this thread applied, this is due to the Phenom's Turbo Core technology which can cause instability in KSP. You can disable Turbo Core in two ways:

 

  • Add the following line to the target box of a shortcut after KSP.exe: "-force-gfx-st" (without the quotes)
  • Disable it in the Bios / UEFI
